intro: Cathartolinum rigidum, commonly known as the rigid cathartolinum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its upright, woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
